title: Roberto Ascari
about
text: Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: about
text:
Running Code
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

1 + 1

[1] 2


You can add options to executable code like this


[1] 4


The echo: false option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

title: Roberto Ascari
text:
About me
I am an Assistant Professor in Statistics at the Department of Economics, Management and Statistics (DEMS) at University of Milano-Bicocca.
Research interests: Compositional data analysis; Bayesian inference; Mixture models; Computational Statistics; Regression models for bounded responses; Latent topic models.
E-mail: roberto.ascari@unimib.it

Projects

Scientific Degrees Plan: presenting statistics to high schools (from 2018 to 2024)

title: Roberto Ascari
text:
I am interested on Bayesian Analysis, especially on Bayesian Nonparametric models. My research is based on exploring innovative approaches in model-based clustering. I am currently working on:

Bayesian clustering methods with high dimensional data;
Multivariate time series with changepoint detection.
Topic modelling techniques with distributions defined on the simplex.

title: Roberto Ascari
text:

title: Alice Giampino
Alice Giampino
text:
PhD courses projects

Gradient - R package: R package to calculate the gradient of a function.
Post selection inference fMRI Data: visualization of active area in a brain during an experiment.
Forest Fire Bayesian Analysis: an analysis of the burnt area for forest fires in Portugal.

title: Alice Giampino
text:
Education
 - Ph.D. in Statistical Sciences, University of Milano-Bicocca, Milan, Italy.
Period 2019--2023. 
Thesis title: [*Innovative approaches to Bayesian Clustering Methods: parametric and nonparametric perspectives*](files/PhD_thesis_Alice_Giampino.pdf).  
I worked under the joint supervision of  prof. [Bernardo Niporti](https://www.bernardonipoti.com/) and prof. [Michele Guindani](https://www.micheleguindani.info/). 

M.Sc. in Statistical Sciences, University of Milano-Bicocca, Milan, Italy.
Period 2017 - 2019. Final mark: 110/110 with laude.
Thesis title: Functional telecommunication data: a Bayesian nonparametric approach.

Advisor: Sonia Migliorati.

B.Sc. in Statistical sciences, University of Milano-Bicocca, Milan, Italy.

Period 2014–2017. Final mark: 110/110 with laude.
Thesis title: Box-Cox transformation: an analysis based on the likelihood.
Advisor: Sonia Migliorati.

title: Roberto Ascari
text:
Education

Ph.D. in Statistics and Mathematics for Finance, University of Milano-Bicocca.
Period: 2015 - 2018.
Thesis: A family of flexible mixture distributions for constrained data.
Advisor: Prof. Andrea Ongaro.
M.Sc. in Biostatistics, University of Milano-Bicocca.
Period: 2013 - 2015. Final mark: 110/110 with honors.
Thesis: MCMC Bayesian estimation for a particular mixture model on the simplex.
Advisor: Prof. Sonia Migliorati.
B.Sc. in Statistics and Information Management, University of Milano-Bicocca.
Period: 2019 - 2013. Final mark: 107/110.
Thesis: Mortality and respiratory tract infections in a population of 7000 patients undergoing cardiac surgery.
Advisor: Prof. Vincenzo Bagnardi.

title: Roberto Ascari
Roberto Ascari
Roberto Ascari
text:
Conferences

2024 - 15th International Conference of the ERCIM WG on Computational and Methodological Statistics, 13–16 December 2024, London (UK).
Invited talk: Identifying microbiome communities and enterotypes using a novel mixed-membership model.
2024 - SIS2024, 52nd scientific meeting of the Italian Statistical Society, 17–20 June 2024, Bari (Italy).
Contributed talk: A new distribution for overdispersed count data.
2023 - 14th CLAssification and Data Analysis Group (CLADAG), 11–13 September 2023, Salerno (Italy).
Contributed talk: A flexible topic model.
2023 - SIS2023, Statistical Learning, Sustainability and Impact Evaluation, 21–23 June 2023, Ancona (Italy).
Invited talk: An alternative to the Dirichlet-multinomial regression model for microbiome data analysis.
2022 - 15th International Conference of the ERCIM WG on Computational and Methodological Statistics, 17–19 December 2022, London (UK).
Invited talk: A generalization of the latent Dirichlet allocation.
2022 - 17th conference of the International Federation of Classification Societies (iFCS)’’. 19–23 July 2022. Porto (Portugal).
Contributed talk: A New Regression Model for the Analysis of Microbiome Data.
2022 - ISBA World Meeting, 26 June – 1 July, Montreal (Canada).
Poster: The flexible Dirichlet-multinomial regression model.
2021 - 13th CLAssification and Data Analysis Group (CLADAG), 9–11 September 2021, Florence (Italy).
Contributed talk: A full mixture of experts model to classify constrained data.
2021 - 19th Conference of the Applied Stochastic Models and Data Analysis (ASMDA) International Society, 1–4 June 2021, Atene (Greece).
Organizer of the session: Regression models for responses with bounded support.
2021 - 19th Conference of the Applied Stochastic Models and Data Analysis (ASMDA) International Society, 1–4 June 2021, Atene (Greece).
Contributed talk: A new regression model for count compositions.

2021 - SIS2021, 21–25 June 2021.   Contributed talk: Alternative parameterizations for regression models with constrained multivariate responses.
2020 - 6th Stochastic Modeling Techniques and Data Analysis (SMTDA) International Conference, 2–5 June 2020.
Invited talk: The flexible beta-binomial regression model.
2019 - 12th International Conference of the ERCIM WG on Computational and Methodological Statistics, 14–16 December 2019, London (UK).
Contributed talk: A new regression model for discrete data allowing for overdispersion.
2019 - SIS2019, Smart Statistics for Smart Applications, 18–21 June 2019, Milan (Italy).
Contributed talk: A new regression model for bounded multivariate responses.
2019 - 18th Conference of the Applied Stochastic Models and Data Analysis (ASMDA) International Society. 11–14 June 2019, Florence (Italy).
Contributed talk: A new simplex distribution allowing for positive covariances.
2018 - 11th International Conference of the ERCIM WG on Computational and Methodological Statisticsm 14–16 December 2018, Pisa (Italy).
Contributed talk: A new Dirichlet-multinomial mixture model for count data.
2017 - 11th CLAssification and Data Analysis Group (CLADAG)’’}, 13–15 September 2017, Milan (Italy).
Contributed talk: A Special Dirichlet Mixture Model in a Bayesian Perspective.
2017 - 17th Conference of the Applied Stochastic Models and Data Analysis (ASMDA) International Society, 6–9 June 2017, London (UK).
Contributed talk: The Extended Flexible Dirichlet model: a simulation study.

title: Roberto Ascari
text:
Award

Young Talents Award, 2024 Edition - University of Milano-Bicocca with the sponsorship of the “Accademia Nazionale dei Lincei”. [Third Prize]{https://www.unimib.it/news/premio-giovani-talenti-ecco-vincitori-delledizione-2024}

title: Roberto Ascari
text:
Submitted papers

A new Dirichlet-multinomial mixture regression model for the analysis of microbiome data. Submitted to The Annals of Applied Statistics (second submission).
A new mixed-membership model for community and enterotype detection for microbiome data. Submitted to Computational Statistics & Data Analysis. Joint work with Alice Giampino and Sonia Migliorati.
FlexReg: an R package for fitting regression models on bounded univariate responses. To be resubmitted. Joint work with Agnese M. Di Brisco, Sonia Migliorati, and Andrea Ongaro.
